Name: **Submit others work**
Description: Users with this permission can submit work to an assignment for other users. This means they can submit work that will have another user as the author.

Name: **Submit own work** \*
Description: Users with this permission can submit their work to assignments of this course. Usually only students have this permission.

Name: **Edit others work**
Description: Users with this permission can edit files in the submissions of this course. Usually TAs and teachers have this permission, so they can change files in the CodeGra.de filesystem if code doesn't compile, for example.

Name: **Grade submission**
Description: Users with this permission can grade submissions.

Name: **See grade before done**
Description: Users with this permission can see the grade for a submission before an assignment is set to "done".

Name: **See others submission**
Description: Users with this permission can see submissions of other users of this course.

Name: **See assignments** \*
Description: Users with this permission can view the assignments of this course.

Name: **See hidden assignments**
Description: Users with this permission can view assignments of this course that are set to "hidden".

Name: **Linter**
Description: Users with this permission can run linters on all submissions of an assignment.

Name: **Edit assignment info**
Description: Users with this permission can update the assignment info such as name, deadline and status.

Name: **Assign graders**
Description: Users with this permission can assign a grader to submissions of assignments.

Name: **Edit .cgignore**
Description: Users with this permission can edit the .cgignore file for an assignment.

Name: **Upload BlackBoard zip**
Description: Users with this permission can upload a zip file with submissions in the BlackBoard format.

Name: **Edit course roles**
Description: Users with this permission can assign or remove permissions from course roles and add new course roles.

Name: **Edit course users**
Description: Users with this permission can add users to this course and assign roles to those users.

Name: **Create assignment**
Description: Users with this permission can create new assignments for this course.

Name: **Upload after deadline**
Description: Users with this permission can submit their work after the deadline of an assignment.

Name: **See assignee**
Description: Users with this permission can see who is assigned to assess a submission.

Name: **Manage rubrics**
Description: Users with this permission can update the rubrics for the assignments of this course.

Name: **View teacher revision** \*
Description: Users with this permission can view the teacher's revision of their submitted work.

Name: **Grade history**
Description: Users with this permission can see the grade history of an assignment.

Name: **Delete submission**
Description: Users with this permission can delete submissions.

Name: **Update grader status**
Description: Users with this permission can change the status of graders for this course, whether they are done grading their assigned submissions or not.

Name: **Update course notifications**
Description: Users with this permission can change the all notifications that are configured for this course. This includes when to send them and who to send them to.

Name: **Edit the maximum grade possible**
Description: Users with this permission can edit the maximum grade possible, and therefore also determine if getting a 'bonus' for an assignment is also possible.

Name: **View plagiarism**
Description: Users with this permission can view the summary of a plagiarism check and see details of a plagiarism case. To view a plagiarism case between this and another course, the user must also have either this permission, or both "See assignments" and "See other's work" in the other course.

Name: **Manage plagiarism**
Description: Users with this permission can add and delete plagiarism runs.

Name: **List course users** \*
Description: Users with this permission can see all users of this course including the name of their role.
